summary: Judo is a modern Japanese martial art and Olympic sport created in 1882 by Kanō Jigorō. It focuses on throwing, pinning, and submitting opponents without striking or weapons. Judo practitioners are called judoka, and they wear a uniform called a judogi. The goal is to score points by throwing or controlling your opponent. Judo's philosophy emphasizes efficient use of energy and mutual benefit, influencing many other martial arts worldwide.
title: Judo
